#Demonstartion of Scalar
import numpy as np
from numpy import generic
def isscalar(num):
    if isinstance(num,generic):
        return True
    else :
        return False
a = 10
b = 5.5
print("Deep Learning Practical")
print("Type of a :",type(a))
print("Type of b :",type(b))
print(a + b)
print(a - b)
print(a * b)
print(np.isscalar(3))
print(np.isscalar(3.1))
list1 = [1,2,3]
print(np.isscalar(list1))
source.b1c05382:
#Demonstration of Vectors
import numpy as np
x = np.array([10, 20, 30])
y = np.array([50, 60, 70])
print("Deep Learning Practical")
print("Type of Vector X :",type(x))
print("Type of Vector Y :",type(y))
print("Vector X :",x)
print("Vector Y :",y)
print("Concatenation of Two Vectors :",(x + y))
z = np.add(x,y)
print("Addition of Two Vectors :",z)
m = np.cross(x,y)
print("Multiplication of Two Vectors :",m)
